intro: Trautvetteria japonica f. breviloba, commonly known as the dwarf Japanese trautvetteria, is a compact, herbaceous perennial belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows to a height of around 10–20 centimeters, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a ground cover. Native to Japan, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
